Sentencas: Performance and stability of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) have been continuously improved at the single-cell level.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: Connecting the individual cells by a metallic interconnector (MIC) in a stack, though, yields remarkable losses in performance and leads to an enhanced degradation.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: These effects are attributed to, inter alia, Cr evaporation from the MIC and, thus, Cr poisoning of the cathode.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: To determine the degradation rate caused by Cr poisoning, this paper focuses on the differences in single cell performance and short-term stability by using either an inert flowfielcl or a flowfield made of a chromia-forming alloy.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: To provide a homogeneous current collection and gas distribution over the complete cathode area and to avoid a direct contact between MIC made of Crofer22APU and LSM, a platinum mesh was used as current collector.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: The cell performance was evaluated by analyzing its current-voltage characteristics and using electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: A detailed analysis of impedance spectra by the distribution of relaxation times (DRT) and a subsequent Complex Nonlinear Least Squares (CLNS) fit facilitated the separation of anodic and cathodic polarization processes.
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning

Sentencas: In the presence of a chromia-forming alloy the polarization resistance of the cathode showed a significantly higher initial value (+64 m Omega.cm(2)) than without and a high degradation rate of 213 mu Omega.cm(2) h(-1) during 280 h of galvanostatic operation at 800 degrees C. (C) 2010
Titulo: Degradation of anode supported cell (ASC) performance by Cr-poisoning
